title: Jonathan Kodjia
snippet: During his time at Angers in the 2014–15 Ligue 2 season, Kodjia was named the UNFP Ligue 2 Player of the Year after scoring 15 league goals and contributing significantly to the team's promotion to Ligue 1.[70] At Aston Villa, Kodjia earned the PFA Fans' Championship Player of the Month award for November 2016, recognizing his impactful performances, including multiple goals that helped the team climb the Championship table.[71] Kodjia holds notable goal-scoring records from his club career, such as being Bristol City's top scorer in the 2015–16 Championship season with 19 league goals.[29] Internationally, he was joint-top scorer for Ivory Coast at the 2019 Africa Cup of Nations with two goals, scored against South Africa in the group stage and Algeria in the quarterfinals.
